meanings.definition: The act of covering with clouds or darkness.
meanings.sent1: During the storm, the overcastings made it impossible to see the sun.
meanings.sent2: The overcastings in the sky blocked out the stars at night.
meanings.sent3: The overcastings seemed to play hide-and-seek with the moon.
meanings.sent4: The overcastings hung over the city like a heavy blanket.
meanings.sent5: The overcastings created a gloomy atmosphere all around.

meanings.definition: A layer of clouds covering the sky.
meanings.sent1: The overcastings above us made the day feel dim and cool.
meanings.sent2: I hope the overcastings clear up so we can see the blue sky.
meanings.sent3: The overcastings looked like a fluffy white carpet above our heads.
meanings.sent4: The overcastings rolled in like a giant cotton ball covering the sun.
meanings.sent5: The overcastings cast a shadow over the landscape below.

meanings.definition: The process of sewing a line of stitches over the edge of fabric to prevent fraying.
meanings.sent1: She carefully did the overcastings on the hem of her dress to keep it neat.
meanings.sent2: The tailor's skillful overcastings ensured the edges of the fabric stayed intact.
meanings.sent3: The overcastings on the curtains added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent4: Her overcastings were so precise that the fabric looked professionally finished.
meanings.sent5: The overcastings on the tablecloth prevented it from unraveling at the edges.
